isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB DOOR AND HINGE (AFTER DECEMBER 5, 1994)

svcprocinfo.para: An integral door stop (67 degree opening) (Item 1, Figure 21) is included in the upper hinge used with this door. If hinges are removed, upper and lower hinges should not be interchanged.

figure.caption: Figure 21. Integral Door Stop in Upper Hinge

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. TORX HEAD HINGE STOP REST BOLT

svcprocinfo.para: There is no disassembly of hinges since they are serviced as a complete unit. It should also be noted that hinge mounting holes (Item 2, Figure 21) are enlarged at the cab hinge pillar location, and a sliding tapped mounting/adjustment plate (Item 3, Figure 21) inside the door at door half of hinge provides adjustment for positioning cab door in door opening.

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para: Remove door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Remove.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 22for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. TAPE OVER ACCESS HOLES (WITH TRIM PANEL)

step1.para: If door trim panel removed, remove tape (Item 1) or, if no door trim panel, remove access hole plugs (Item 2) covering hinge mounting bolt access holes (Item 2, Figure 23) in the door panel at upper and lower hinges.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Door Hinge and Mounting Bolts

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. TORX HEAD HINGE STOP REST BOLT

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with power windows, heated mirrors or CB radio antenna on the door, mark the harness connectors for installation, disconnect harness connectors and remove two screws (Item 3) holding the wiring harness bracket (Item 4) to the door panel.
Use a rope sling (or padded chain) through window opening, and attach sling to overhead lift and support door.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 23for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove four flanged head mounting bolts (Item 1) through the access holes (Item 2), two each hinge. Do not remove the torx head hinge stop rest bolt (Item 3) at each hinge; this will keep the tapped hinge mounting/adjustment plate in position allowing door to be put back on without requiring adjustment. Lift door assembly from hinges (Item 4) and wiring harness bracket (Item 5), if so equipped. Pull the wiring harness clear of the door.
Move the door to a work bench or other support as required. Cover the bench with a material that will not scratch painted surfaces of the door.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 24for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before removing hinges from cab hinge pillar (Item 3), mark upper and lower hinge position on cab hinge pillar with grease pencil or similar marker to simplify door adjustment on reassembly. Remove the three flanged head mounting bolts (Item 1) and remove door hinge (Item 2) from the hinge pillar.

svcsubproc.para: Flanged head bolt (Item 1) recessed behind hinge inside pillar can best be removed with a universal (flex) socket. Be careful when removing bolt to avoid dropping it inside the pillar.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 24for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position upper and lower door hinge (Item 2) onto cab hinge pillar (Item 3) with the aid of markings on hinge pillar. Use a universal (flex) socket and install the flanged head mounting bolts (Item 1). Tighten to 13 to 15 ft-lbs. (17.6 to 20 N·m).

note.para: Be sure the hinge with the integral door stop is put back in the upper door hinge location.

step1.para: Using a rope sling (or padded chain) through window opening, attach sling to overhead lift and support door.
If vehicle is equipped with power windows, heated mirrors or CB radio antenna on the door, position wiring harness in the door and reconnect harness connectors.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 23for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position door assembly onto door hinges (Item 4) and wiring harness bracket (Item 5). If so equipped, secure the wiring harness bracket to the door panel with the two screws (Item 6). Also position hinges against the torx head stop rest bolts (Item 3) inside door and secure with four flanged head mounting bolts (Item 1), two each hinge. Tighten to 20 to 28 ft-lbs. (27 to 38 N·m). Refer to Figure 21for hinge placement against stop rest bolt and tapped mounting/adjustment plate inside door.
If door trim panel is to be re-installed, replace tape (Item 1, Figure 22) or, if no door trim panel, reinstall access hole plugs (Item 2, Figure 23) in the door panel at upper and lower hinges.
Install door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Install.
Adjust the door if required. Refer to ADJUSTMENTS.
